description.en: During the course the characteristics and functions of a financial accounting, the accounting and evaluating of the assets of a firm, the accounting of capital and owners' equity, the preparation of annual report and the methods of financial statement analysis are observed. Also the costs in the management accounting and the principles of the budgeting and reporting of the company are explained in detail.
description.et: Käsitletakse majandusarvestuse olemust ja funktsioone, ettevõtte vara hindamist ja arvestust, võõr- ja omakapitali, tulude-kulude arvestust, raamatupidamise aastaaruande koostamist ja selle analüüsi eesmärke ning meetodeid. Vaadeldakse kulusid juhtimisarvestuse seisukohast, selgitatakse ettevõttesisese planeerimise ja aruandluse põhimõtteid.

objectives.en: The objective of this course is to introduce the nature of the accounting and its role in the business management system, and the methodological principles of the accounting.
objectives.et: Tutvustada üliõpilastele majandusarvestuse olemust, liike, nende rolli ettevõtte juhtimissüsteemis ja metoodilisi aluseid.

learning_outcomes.en: On completion of this module the individual
1)	understands the basic accounting terms and concepts, the role of financial and management accounting;
learning_outcomes.et: 1)	oskab selgitada majandusarvestuse liike, ülesandeid ja nende põhimõisteid;

learning_outcomes.en: 2)	knows the basic methods of assets, liabilities and owners' equity accounting;
learning_outcomes.et: 2)	teab põhilisi meetodeid vara, kohustuste, omakapitali, tulude ja kulude arvestamisel;

learning_outcomes.en: 3)	knows how to use financial ratios analyzing the annual reports of the company;
learning_outcomes.et: 3)	oskab kasutada finantssuhtarve ettevõtte majandusaasta aruannete analüüsil;

learning_outcomes.en: 4)	is able to solve the typical management accounting exercises.

notes.et:
Lectures will be held according to the general rules of the University (classroom lecture or distance learning) and taking into account the specifications of the syllabus. 
About distance learning a notice will be given via SIS and Moodle. 
Midterm will be held using Moodle capabilities.

independent_work.et:
Home assignments: Moodle tests, presentation (to be prepared and presented in groups) and individual assignment. Instructions about topics, deadlines, etc. will be given during the lectures. 
Assignments must be submitted by the deadline.

description.et: 20 points - 8 tests in Moodle (2,5 points each test). Learning outcomes 1, 2, 3, 4. To be submitted the day before the exam at the latest.

6 points - presentation in groups. Max 6 students in the group, the length of the presentation 12 - 15 minutes. Detailed instructions (topics, due date, etc.) will be given during the lectures. Learning outcome 1, 2, 3.
4 points - individual assignment. Detailed instructions (description, due date, etc.) will be given during the lectures. Learning outcomes 1, 2, 3.
15 points. Managerial accounting (45 min, closed books, test in Moodle). Learning outcome 4.

Final Exam includes : 
-	accounting (theory and exercises) 20 points, 
-	analysis of financial statements (theory and exercises) 15 points,
-	managerial accounting (theory and exercises) 20 points.
Total 55 points. Learning outcomes 1-4.

grade_preconditions.et: Students should do and present all home assignments and midterm test duly.

grade_evaluation.et:
Possible points of different parts:
-	accounting 30 points (home work 10 p + exam 20 p),
-	analysis 35 points (home work 20 p + exam 15 p),
-	managerial accounting 35 punkti (test 15 p + exam 20 p).
Total 100 points. Each part will be evaluated separately.

debt_elimination.et: One option to re-take the exam will be given.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

description.et: Importance of accounting. Users of accounting information. Opportunities in accounting. Financial accounting, managerial accounting. (4h)
Financial Statements - balance sheet, income statement, statement of owner's equity, statement of cash flows. (4h.
Financial Statements - balance sheet, income statement, statement of owner's equity, statement of cash flows. (4h)
Trial balance. Adjusting accounts and preparing financial statements. (4h)
Accounting of current assets, long-term assets. (4h)
Accounting of liabilities and owners equity. (4h)

Managerial accounting basics. Managerial cost consept. Job order cost accounting. Process cost accounting. Cost allocation. Cost behavior. Break-even analysis. Applying cost-volume-profit analysis. (4h) Mariia Chebotareva.
Allocation costs for performance and evaluation. Job order costing. Process costing. Activity based costing. (4h) Mariia Chebotareva.

Managerial accounting - case study. (3h) Mariia Chebotareva.
Midterm. (1h) Mariia Chebotareva.
